tool_description: Access real-time data as soon as it's posted! With the Twitter AIO API, you can retrieve tweets, spaces, media and profiles instantly. Say goodbye to expensive fees charged by Twitter while still getting access to all the available data.
name: Twitter AIO
title: Twitter AIO

api_list.name: Basic user followings by userId
api_list.description: You'll receive a basic list of all followings a user has. Please provide only the userId and you'll receive the following followings data: id, username, createdDate, followings, followers.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The example userId is from elonmusk

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/user/44196397/followings/basic"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/user/{userid}/followings/basic"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Tweet Details
api_list.description: Receive all tweet informations and comments by tweetId. ⚠️ For large cursors (many replies you want to fetch) you can use the POST-request to be not limited by the GET-request length limit.

optional_parameters.name: includeTimestamp
optional_parameters.description: Decide if you want a unix created_at timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.name: Trends
api_list.description: Get twitter trends for worldwide or a specific region.

required_parameters.name: locationId
required_parameters.description: You can get this locationId from misc/locations. It is a WOEID from Yahoo.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/trends/1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/trends/{locationid}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: User Followings by userId
api_list.description: Receive all followings of a user. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.name: User Followers by userId
api_list.description: Receive all followers of a user. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

api_list.name: Tweets and Replies by userId
api_list.description: Receive all tweets and replies ordered by most recent. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

api_list.name: Media by userId
api_list.description: Receive all media items ordered by most recent. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.name: User Details by userId
api_list.description: This is the prefered method of getting any information. Receive follower counts, images and more user related data with this endpoint.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId is mostly mentioned as restId.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/user/44196397"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/user/{userid}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Tweets by userId
api_list.description: Receive all tweets ordered by most recent. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.description: Receive all likes of a user. You can use the cursor and count to navigate around.

required_parameters.description: The userId of the user. You can get it by converting a username to the userId or by searching a user and extracting the restId.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.name: Twitter hashtag emojis
api_list.description: Receive a full list of all twitter custom emojis with the hashtag, image and more.

api_list.name: Tweet Retweets
api_list.description: Receive all retweets for a tweet.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

api_list.name: Tweet Likes
api_list.description: Receive all likes for a tweet.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

api_list.name: Convert username to userId
api_list.description: You'll need the userId to receive tweets, media and replies.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/username/to/id/elonmusk"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com/username/to/id/{username}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twitter-aio.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description: With the search endpoint you can search all of twitter. You just need to provide a search term. ⚠ If you have a large cursor the GET-request will limit at some length. For that you can use a POST-request which has no limits.

optional_parameters.name: includeTimestamp
optional_parameters.description: Decide if you need a unix created_at timestamp. This will slightly increase the speed of the request.

optional_parameters.name: filters
optional_parameters.description: Learn more about all filters by reading the docs :)

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The default count is 20. You can specify a custom one here.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: At the end of the entries array you'll find two objects with the type TimelineTimelineCursor. There is one cursor to go up (Top) and one for going down (bottom) the list. You just need to provide the value as the cursor parameter to get the next page of the pagination.
